page.title: 11UPHAM PLAYERS
page.content: The Upham Players is a thriving, energetic and well supported Amateur Dramatic Society which was founded in 1968. When money was needed to repair the Church bells, a group of villagers got together to present an Old-Time Music Hall. This was enjoyed so much, by audience and performers alike, that a public meeting was held and "Upham Players" formed as a result. There is now a membership of about 60, including several complete families. Each year a pantomime is produced after Christmas with the entire script and some of the music having been written by members of the group. In the Autumn there is usually a Music Hall or Revue and in the Spring a full length play. All the productions are staged in the Village Hall, where sets are built and scenery painted before performances.
